greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Bessel polynomial {y_n}'(-1).
comment: Absolute values give partitions into pairs.
reference: G. Kreweras and Y. Poupard, Sur les partitions en paires d'un ensemble fini totalement ordonné, Publications de l'Institut de Statistique de l'Université de Paris, 23 (1978), 57-74.
J. Riordan, Combinatorial Identities, Wiley, 1968, p. 77.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..400
Index entries for sequences related to Bessel functions or polynomials
formula: a(n) = 2*n*(1/2)_{n} * (-2)^(n-1) * hyergeometric1f1(1-n; -2*n; -2), where (a)_{n} is the Pochhammer symbol.
G.f.: (x/(1-x)^3)*hypergeometric2f0(2,3/2; - ; -2*x/(1-x)^2), for offset 0. - _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 16 2017
mathematica: Join[{0}, Table[2*n*Pochhammer[1/2, n]*(-2)^(n - 1)* Hypergeometric1F1[1 - n, -2*n, -2], {n,1,50}]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 14 2017 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
